item.description:
Hi Everyone,

MEETING TIME:  ---WE CAN MEET  IN WETHERSFIELD at my home (address mailed out in a separate e-mail to positive RSVP's SOON )  at 10:00 am -- THEN CARPOOL DOWN TO MERIDEN --- OR ----- YOU CAN JUST MEET US THERE at the High school pool either inside or outside when we get there --- most likely around 11:00 or so.

i will be wearing my orange hunting hat----can not miss me with that one on.


There is some time till this event happens and some simple changes or updates may occur..

Please waite till i send out a notice a few days before when i know the weather, Cheri's updated schedule and any other things necessary for the event to go on..

This is an event for us to ONLY VIEW advanced paddling techniques so you can decide if you want to learn how to roll your kayak in the future.

WE are not going in the water at this time.

(YOU WILL PRACTICE SELF RESCUE AT BOLTON LAKE IN THE SPRING-SUMMER SEASON)

WE May only stay an hour or so till you get bored --- then its on to the Pot Luck Event Part of the event. Bring something good.

I will Barbie-Q some Chicken..etc..

The ConnYak members tend to practice in the pool  outside of the " Official Lesson" area and you can also talk to some of them...etc...

IF you have an interest in learning to roll by Cheri Perry: then schedule with Cheri Perry if you feel this is a skill you want to learn from her. http://kayakways.net/

 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pool Sessionshttp://kayakways.net/
Hosted by Cheri Perry 

8:30-1:00

Platt High School 220 COE AVE Meriden

----------------------------

POOL ENTRANCE IS ON OREGON ROAD PARKING LOT as best as i know of  at this time !

Parking Verified by: http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7011/6634820063_b697372e11_b.jpg 
Here is a link for Platt High School, I would suggest parking on the Oregon Rd parking lot. 
Thanks Dave for providing the link! 
Best, Happy New Year! 
Cheri

From Hartford : Take I-91 South toward Meriden

Take exit # 18 onto I-691

Go 2.4 miles to exit # 6 follow singes to LEWIS AVE.

Turn Right onto Lewis Ave, go .8 mile 

Take right onto CT 71 = West Main St - go .4 mile

Bear Left onto Centenial Ave.

Pass  COE AVE onto OREGON RD

Take left into parking lot, pool is building near track.

You can also Look for cars with kayak roof racks in parking lot(s) since they will be the ones in the water practicing.

I WILL BE WEARING MY ORANGE HUNTING HAT AND LEAVE A CONE IN THE PARKING LOT WHERE WE WILL MEET PRIOR TO GOING INTO THE POOL ROOM.

------------------------------------------------------------

 

Event is cancelled if bad weather (http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?site=box&FcstType=text&zmx=1&zmy=1&map.x=45&map.y=199&site=BOX) interfeers with the Pool and or Cherri"s attendance.

I will update as best as i can prior to the event day.

-----------------------------------------------------

In less than 1 hour Cherri Perry will have you do this:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=shmB005wJQI&feature=related

In 1.263 hours you will be able to do this even if you have a bath tub kayak and are out of shape:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vTsFLbEmXLM

Disclaimer: Your performance may not be the same... :-)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you are interested in the Personal instruction option prior to us going to the Pool for the "Watch Her and everyone else in the pool Event", please email Cherri to reserve a personalized INSTRUCTION spot,

 

Or when we watch first, schedule it then with her and show us your ability in the summer.

-------------------------------------------------------------------

Description

NEW! Winter 2011-12 Pool Sessions at Platt HIgh School, Meriden, Connecticut 

 

Getting there: Address and driving directions added soon along with after party spot.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

FROM CHERI PERRY'S WEBSITE: http://kayakways.net/

We are once again offering both drop-in and instructional pool sessions to the kayaking community in Connecticut. Pool rental rates have SKYROCKETED this year in Wallingford as well as several other locations, but Cheri has done some research. made a lot of phone calls and found something we think will work for everyone! 

Sundays! 

x 
Jan 8th <------------------------PROPOSED DATE FOR OUR EVENT
Feb 5th 
March 4th 

Pool hours 8:30-1pm 

Drop-in - Connyak & Qajaq USA members $25, non-members $30, Folks with dirty kayaks, $500! ;-) 

Instruction - Kayak Ways LLC will also continue to offer instruction, one-hour slots, 2 to 1 maximum ratio, use of a low-volume rolling kayak, Greenland paddle and norsaq, and a tuiliq for the hour, or your own kayak and equipment, plus the additional pool time that day. $120, or, for CONNYAK and QajaqUSA members, $100. (This includes the pool entry fee.) 

8:45, 9:50, 10:55 and 12:00 slots are available for hour long lessons. You may, of course, sign up for a two hour slot if you are game! 

If you are interested in the instruction option, please email us to reserve a spot, (give us your available dates, and time options). Mail us at cheri@kayakways.net. 

Please, do not forget, please!, bring clean kayaks to the pool! 

We welcome any and all observers. If you are learning to roll, or learning to teach, and just want to watch to pick up pointers, please feel free to observe. The atmosphere will be fun and social!

Cheri Perry.

 

See some of you soon..

al-r
item.how_to_find_us: Details Added closer to the event day.

item.name: JAN 8-- KAYAK ROLLING DEMONSTRATIONS -&- Home Potluck After Party @ Wethersfield
